TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class HashIndex : Microsoft.Azure.Documents.Index, ICloneable
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HashIndex extends Microsoft.Azure.Documents.Index implements class System.ICloneable

Docs.summary: Represents details of the hash index setting in an Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: Can be used to serve queries like: SELECT * FROM docs d WHERE d.prop = 5.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Documents.DataType dataType) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the target data type for the index path specification.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with specified DataType for the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.example:

HashIndex hashIndex = new HashIndex(DataType.String);

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Azure.Documents.DataType dataType, int16 precision) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the target data type for the index path specification.
Specifies the precision to be used for the data type associated with this index.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with specified DataType and precision for the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.example:
Here is an example to instantiate HashIndex class passing in the DataType and precision:
HashIndex hashIndex = new HashIndex(DataType.String, 3);

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a copy of the hash index for the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.returns: A clone of the hash index.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data type for which this index should be applied in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: The data type for which this index should be applied.
Docs.remarks: Refer to Customizing the indexing policy of a collection for valid ranges of values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the precision for this particular index in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: The precision for this particular index. Returns null, if not set.
Docs.remarks: Refer to Customizing the indexing policy of a collection for valid ranges of values.
